newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Handelsbanken to look at selling Stadshypotek Bank.
newsitem.headline: Handelsbanken to look at selling Stadshypotek Bank.

text.p: Swedish bank Handelsbanken said on Tuesday it would now look thoroughly at its acquisition Stadshypotek and discuss whether to reconsider the strategy not to have a separate phone bank.
If this is not the case then one unit of the mortgage lender, Stadshypotek Bank, would be sold, Handelsbanken's chief executive Arne Martensson told a news conference.
"Stadshypotek Bank is an excellent bank but there is an internal decision that we do not want to have a separate telephone bank," Martensson said.

"If we want to change our mind on this we have a good chance to do so now. We will look at this and if we choose to stick with our strategy, which I believe, we will sell Stadshypotek Bank," said Martensson.
Handelsbanken announced on Monday that it had received over 98 percent of votes in Stadshypotek, the country's largest mortgage lender, securing its 22.9 billion crown cash takeover bid.
The state owned 34 percent of Stadshypotek.
According to Stadshypotek's 1996 report, Stadshypotek Bank has 105,000 accounts and a balance sheet of 4.2 billion crowns.
